title: Correlation is not causation
text: Correlation only shows association, not cause and effect. Think of a third variable that might influence both.

hintAnswer: Because larger or more dangerous fires require more firefighters
title: Search for a third variable
text: Why are more firefighters sent to some fires than others?
choices: Because firefighters want to create more damage
Because larger or more dangerous fires require more firefighters
Because the number of firefighters is chosen randomly
Because firefighters always travel in large groups regardless of fire size

hintAnswer: Damage increases first, and then more firefighters are called as a response
title: Examine cause and effect
text: Which comes first — more damage or more firefighters?
choices: Firefighters arrive and then create damage
Damage increases first, and then more firefighters are called as a response
Both occur at the same time with no ordering
Firefighters cause the damage before the fire spreads

hintAnswer: Yes, a larger fire causes more damage and requires more firefighters
title: Third variable
text: Could the size of the fire explain both the number of firefighters and the damage?
choices: Yes, a larger fire causes more damage and requires more firefighters
No, fire size has no influence on damage or number of firefighters
No, the number of firefighters determines the fire size
Yes, but only because firefighters increase the size of the fire.
